title: Data Analyst
description:
Olala Homes is a unique tech-enabled hospitality management company focusing on the short-term vacation rental segment through the ownership and management of over 400 units across multiple countries and cities. Olala Homes‚Äô lean business model coupled with its real estate development expertise and topped with its strong team form a solid base for its ambitious future expansion plan across Spain, Europe, and beyond. The company‚Äôs HQ is located in Barcelona with satellite offices in Greece, Romania, Portugal, and Israel. Olala Homes is part of the Rina Group, a group of companies investing in Tourism & Hospitality, Industrial Minerals, Real Estate, and Agriculture across 3 continents.
Job Brief We are seeking a skilled and motivated Data Analyst to join our team in the hospitality industry. As a Data Analyst, you will be responsible for collecting, analyzing, and interpreting data to help drive informed decision-making and improve operational efficiency within our organization. Your expertise in data analysis and strong business acumen will play a crucial role in optimizing our operations, enhancing customer experiences, and identifying growth opportunities. This is an exciting opportunity for a talented individual to contribute to the success of our organization through data-driven insights.
Main responsibilities:Data Collection and Analysis: Gather data from various sources, including internal databases, customer feedback, and external data sets. Analyze and interpret this data to identify trends, patterns, and insights relevant to the hospitality industry.Performance Tracking: Develop and maintain performance metrics and dashboards to monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) across different aspects of our hospitality operations. Regularly evaluate and report on performance trends, providing actionable recommendations for improvement.Operational Efficiency: Identify areas of operational inefficiencies and collaborate with cross-functional teams to develop strategies and solutions. Utilize data analysis techniques to optimize processes, reduce costs, and enhance productivity within the organization.Customer Insights: Analyze customer feedback, preferences, and behavior to generate actionable insights that can be used to enhance customer experiences. Provide recommendations on how to improve customer satisfaction and loyalty based on data analysis.Data Visualization and Reporting: Create visually appealing and informative reports, charts, and presentations to effectively communicate complex data insights to both technical and non-technical stakeholders. Use data visualization tools and techniques to present findings in a clear and concise manner.Continuous Learning and Improvement: Stay updated with the latest data analysis techniques, tools, and industry trends. Proactively identify opportunities for process improvement and propose innovative solutions to enhance the effectiveness and efficiency of data analysis.
Requirements:Minimum 2 years of experience as a Data Analyst or Business Data AnalystBS in Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Information Management or StatisticsTechnical expertise regarding data models, database design development, data mining and segmentation techniques. Preferably within the hospitality industry.Excellent written and verbal communication skillsStrong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracyAdvanced knowledge in Excel, SQL and PhytonFamiliarity with database management systems and data warehousing concepts.Experience in building reports for data visualization (ideally Power BI)Zendesk Knowledge is a big plusProfessional level of English 
If you are passionate about data analysis and its application to the hospitality industry, and if you thrive in a dynamic and results-oriented environment, we would love to hear from you. Join our team and contribute to shaping the future of our organization through data-driven decision-making.
What we offer:Competitive salary with other benefits such as employee discounts staying in Olala Homes‚Äô properties, weekly fruit basket in the office, happy hour, etc.Opportunity to be mentored by experienced professionals and gain first-hand know-how in a swift pacePositive corporate culture to be proud to be a part of a fast growing company

title: Tech Data Analyst
description:
Join eDreams ODIGEO, the largest Online Travel Agency in Europe, and make your professional journey a success in one of the most innovative companies in the e-commerce space
eDreams ODIGEO is one of the world's largest online travel companies and one of the largest e-commerce businesses in Europe. Under its four leading online travel agency brands ‚Äì eDreams, GO Voyages, Opodo, Travellink, and the metasearch engine Liligo ‚Äì it serves more than 18 million customers per year across 46 markets. Listed on the Spanish Stock Market, eDreams ODIGEO works with over 665 airlines and has partnerships with 130. The brand offers the best deals in regular flights, low-cost airlines, hotels, cruises, car rental, dynamic packages, holiday packages and travel insurance to make travel easier, more accessible, and better value for consumers across the globe. Travel is the largest e-commerce segment in the world and eDreams ODIGEO is at the heart of it.
We are now looking for highly skilled technical Data Analysts for several areas as; Customer Support, Marketing Measurement, Data Science, Experiments & Insights, Check Out & others. Our teams are passionate about data, automation, statistical models, technology and innovation and love to work in a collaborative and agile environment.
Customers are at the heart of everything we do. We put them first and foremost. We use data, technology and research to develop insights, products and features that will directly make an impact on a unique traveller experience.
Responsibilities will include: 
 Responsible for execution of key analysis, being the data entry point for the business team and taking ownership of the different data sources from the business side. Understand the business needs, gather the data and present the key insights.  Own P&L metrics identifying the drivers of over and underperformance and providing data driven recommendations for how we can improve the P&L performance  Turn business questions into functional analysis, extract relevant and actionable insights working with data from many different data sources using Python/R/SQL and work with your stakeholders to make them happen;  Elaborate business cases to support strategic product decisions.  Design and execute measurement experiments; Analyse performance and user behaviours in the A/B Tests experiments or Pre-Post run by the business stakeholders;  Create dashboards and tracking: master the internal Business Intelligence tools to contribute to the monitoring and tracking of our business KPIs. Work with data engineering and data science teams to be able to leverage relevant data  Contribute to the delivery of strategic projects: participate in the delivery of key initiatives, giving support from the business side to ensure progress and effective delivery of the desired outcomes. Work together with stakeholders in the execution of the projects, giving support from the analytical and business side 
Desired Skills and Experience:
 Bachelor‚Äôs degree in a quantitative discipline (Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering, Economics, etc.),  Experience in a role with strong analytical component  Strong knowledge of SQL is a requirement, as well as experience in working with databases and large sets of data; python/R programming skills and experience with Looker Studio, Power BI will be required.  Advanced Office skills. Strong experience with analytical tools, ideally with the Google toolset (spreadsheets, google docs, etc)  Strong analytical skills, fast-learner, with high attention to detail and focused on results and productivity  A self-starter and team player, who also enjoys having fun!  Business Proficiency in English
What we offer:
 We support a phenomenal lifestyle and work-life-balance with our flexible hours and flexible remote work policy.  A free eDreams Prime subscription to benefit from significant discounts on your travels.  Competitive compensation package with an attractive bonus structure.  Excellent environment for continuous growth and learning: with our Learning & Development programs, you will have access to tech talks, internal soft skills and technical skills training, language lessons, external events and industry conferences.  Free subscription to Coursera Learning Platform.  Fast-track career development: with our unique programs, you are always working towards the next step on your career path.  New to the city? We also offer great relocation packages.  Additional prizes and awards for a variety of team and individual achievements.  Fun at work: at eDreams ODIGEO, work and fun go hand in hand! 
‚Ä¶ And the opportunity to work on a dynamic, dedicated, fun and passionate team of professionals. We journey together!
Come dream with us and join us now!
eDreams ODIGEO under its four leading online travel agency brands ‚Äì eDreams, GO Voyages, Opodo, Travellink, and the metasearch engine Liligo ‚Äìis an equal opportunity employer and value diversity and inclusion. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status.

title: Data Engineer
description:
Description
Coniq is a dynamic, high growth UK-based SaaS company that provides total customer engagement and loyalty services to many of the world‚Äôs leading property developers, shopping centers and retailers. Coniq powers well over ¬£1 billion of sales annually for its clients, with more than 20 million consumers shopping at 1,800 brands in 24 countries worldwide, and has offices in Europe, the US and the Middle East.
We are looking for a Data Engineer. The role will be responsible for maintaining, optimising and extending our enterprise MySQL databases, peripheral database systems (RDBS and Data warehouse), and data pipeline operations (ETL/ELT management), to sustain our current operational data needs, and to enable Coniq‚Äôs continued growth. Coniq leads the world in providing shopper engagement and loyalty solutions for the most advanced retail destinations and we are looking for talented individuals to join us on our journey.
Ideally, we would like this role to be based in Barcelona to spend some time with our team in the office, however, we‚Äôre open for this role to be remote in Spain.
Reports to Head of Data Operations.
Responsibilities
Maintenance, development and expanding of multiple MySQL databases and data warehousesEnsuring data management systems health and performanceCreating and optimising queries for data analysis and day-to-day data operations required by Coniq‚Äôs applicationsSupporting Data Analysts to transform client data requirements into executable queriesSynchronising data between data sources (MySQL, 3rd Partydata sources, etc.) and data store systems (MySQL, Exasol, etc.)Supporting the application development team to build, validate and optimise database interactionsMaintaining processes to ensure failover and disaster recoverySupporting the development team with data operations to facilitate software deployments
Relevant experience
You have managed a high volume, high performance MySQL database in a multi-tenancy, SaaS environment.You are highly proficient in creating, optimising and maintaining SQL queries and processes - including triggers and stored procedures.Database health and performance is central to your thinking and work - you have experience of performance tuning, optimising and partitioning data in conjunction with analysing query performance.You have designed and maintained processes to replicate data into redundant databases and into read-replica sets - including into different database systems.You have supported an application development team to ensure that all data operations are optimal to the needs of the business.You have an experience working with columnar and non-relational databasesYou have experience modeling and management of ETL/ELT processes on data flow systems; such as airflow, azkaban etc.; between tabular databases and data warehousesYou have scripting experience in Python, bash or similar scripting language
Requirements
Proactive problem solverAble to work independently, identifying problems and solutions and planning for future improvementAble to work with stakeholders that are not data expertsExcellent attention to detailHighly proficient and experienced in any Native SQL - experience of MySQL dialect essentialUnderstanding of Enterprise Queues and pipelinesUnderstanding of APIsA strong understanding of agile methodologiesProficient in Python scripting or similar scripting languageDesirable:Experience maintaining non-relational and columnar databases - Exasol, ElasticSearch, NoSQL etcPerformance tuning and data partitioningKnowledge on data infrastructures and architectures - Hybrid, SMACK, etc.

Benefits
We offer a generous package, including:Competitive salaryCompany stock options25 days holiday plus statutory holidaysA day off to celebrate your birthdayA day off for your wellbeingShorter working hours on FridaysA strong company values framework, including paid leave for volunteering with approved charitiesRegular team building activitiesTraining & development allowanceNew employee referral schemeThis is a unique opportunity to join a VC-funded high growth SaaS business where we all share a passion to work together to build a great product and a great company. We are proud of our company culture and invest a great deal into making sure that we promote Diversity in the workplace. Together we come from over 20 nationalities and as a tech business, we are very proud of the 50/50 gender split.

title: Senior Data Engineer
description:
Thanks to our innovative BuyNow PayLater payment solution, Scalapay is transforming the way more than 2 million customers buy online and in-store, empowering 5,000+ merchants to give their customers magical shopping experiences.
Being only 3 years old didn‚Äôt stop us from becoming a unicorn ü¶Ñ We have raised over $700mln and we did this thanks to a team built around our 4 core values: #createmagic #staycurious #beimpactful #playasateam.
This is where your magic happens. If you love it, Scalapay it ‚ô•
THE MISSION
Data-driven decisions are the centre of our efforts to automate processes and support decisions across the business.
As Senior Data Engineer, your role will focus on developing distributed software for large-scale heterogeneous data processing, the development of ETL and reverse ETL pipeline.
You will be responsible for:
 Data modelling Data lineage Data quality / Data observability SLA, performance and scalability
You‚Äôll be required to discuss requirements for data access and integrations with colleagues across the business, design solutions to the company‚Äôs problems and implement these using modern software processes in the cloud.
The role gives a large amount of autonomy and the chance to work with a top-notch team of experienced data experts.
Who we are looking for: 
 Strong Python and SQL experience Experience building and deploying ETL pipelines Experience with API integration Ability to scope projects and decompose work into tasks Familiarity with Linux-like development stacks, including Git, Kubernetes, etc Familiarity with AWS infrastructure (such as S3, Athena, Glue, etc) Knowledge of Data Modeling / Data Observability is a plus Ability to engage with colleagues on business processes A Bachelor's degree in computer science or a related field
Why you should join Scalapay:
 Attractive packages based on skills and experience International environment with significant challenges to be met every day Lots of opportunities to work with a team of industry tech leaders who are focused on delivering products that offer exceptional user experiences Personalised support to accelerate your professional growth and take ownership of the products you deliver: we want to help you grow! Latest technologies and being encouraged to bring your flair to the role
Recruitment Process:
 A quick chat with one of our Talent Acquisition team members The first interview with the Hiring Manager to deep dive into your experiences and better understand your motivation A case study to test your hard skills A Meet The Team session where you‚Äôll get to meet different people at Scalapay and see if you‚Äôll fit into our culture
_________________________________________________________________________
Want to learn more? Don't hesitate to explore our Careers website and Careers website, and our LinkedIn, WTTJ, Meritocracy and Glassdoor pages.
Pro tip: send your CV in English üòâ
Super Pro tip: we know that application processes can be scary and frustrating but‚Ä¶ we look for talent, not people that tick all our boxes.
We believe in the power of diversity: Scalapay is an Equal Opportunity Employer for any minority, disability, gender identity or sexual orientation.

title: Data Analyst
description:
Smadex is a leading advertising technology company founded in Barcelona in 2011 and sold to American-based and stock-listed Entravision in 2018 (NYSE::EVC). We are currently considered one of the top mobile ad-tech companies in the world, competing with American-based Liftoff and Korean-based Moloco, both in the pre-IPO stage and averaging about $500M in yearly revenues.
We are looking for a Data Analyst with strong SQL and analytics experience to join our Data Analysis Team. Working alongside our Data Engineers, the candidate should be communicative and analytical, in order to answer the complex questions that Product and Campaign performance are facing. For this purpose we use tons of data available to get powerful insights to resolve them, creating effective strategies to help improve the Smadex platform! 
The role is based in Barcelona!
Your tasks and responsibilities:Analyze large, complex data sets containing the behaviour of millions of mobile users and Apps worldwide to address strategic questionsObtain and Report insights from our Product¬¥s performance (ML, Audiences, Creatives, Supply, etc) in order to make decisions that will impact revenue. Have one¬¥s say!Develop automated dashboards and processes to ensure data influence decisions at all levels of the companyWorking cross-functionally with business and technical teams to support product performance
Skills and requirements:2+ years of experience as a Data AnalystWorking knowledge of SQL and large data sets, understanding of analytic methodologies for data evaluationBachelor's or Master's Degree in Engineering or BusinessStrong analytical skills with the ability to get insights.Outstanding communication and reporting skillsExcellent command of Microsoft Excel (Power Pivot & Power Query) Excellent communication skills in English both written and spoken are mandatoryPython/R, Superset, PowerBI experience is a plusDesire to join the ad-tech worldKnowledge of the ad-tech industry is a plus.
Please note that we do NOT provide VISA sponsorship. Candidates without a legal permit to work in Spain won't be considered. What is in it for you:Integrate a highly motivated and young teamGreat compensation packageTop location at the heart of Barcelona in a penthouse office with a rooftop terrace, Barbeque, and a fully stocked fridgeGreat work-life balance: work from home, flexible hoursLearning and training opportunitiesMeal vouchers - Tickets Restaurant monthly allowanceMonthly gym allowance to use in up to 30 DIR gyms around the cityMonthly TGIF eventsRegular team-building eventsFun and friendly work environment with talented marketers and engineers from over 21 countriesExposure to leading global app publishers (Zynga, King, Rovio, EA, etc.) and media partners in the digital advertising industryAnd more!

title: Data Analyst
description:
About Optimissa
Optimissa is a consulting firm specialized in Financial Services.We are always looking for the best consulting enthusiasts.
On this occasion, we are looking for a Data Analyst for one of our major international clients in the insurance industry.

title: Data Analyst
description:
Who we areQuantion is a Business Digital Transformation services company born in 2015.Our services are based on a Digital Factory model. Through this model we help companies to accelerate its digital transformation projects with an end-to-end approach.
We have +120 professionals in application development, UX/UI and digital business transformation to build innovative solutions oriented to business results.
As a Digital Factory we combine our teams in cutting-edge technologies and digital deep experiences with the innovation ecosystem, to ensure that we can provide the best solution to face business challenges, from its concept to its implementation.
We are looking for a Data Analyst to join our Technology team. If you want to participate in one of our biggest International projects, don‚Äôt hesitate to apply!
What you will do: You will be responsible for designing, developing and maintaining data collection architecture, reports, metrics and analyses for different teamsYou will juggling all kinds of data, collect and analyze them and seek for patterns and trends to drive the digital acceleration and future customer experienceYou will utilize big data and business intelligence technologies to shape and drive key business decisions.You'll make analysis results accessible by building and providing dashboards and reports based on business needsYou closely align with business and management teams to assess business needsYou collaborate with the product teams to identify possibilities for improvement and adaptations regarding their digital productsYou will work pragmatically and support my team to deliver high quality solutions with speedYou will work in an international environment with a diverse teamYou will work in an international environment with a highly diverse team
Required skills:At least 2 years of experience as a Digital AnalystExperience in working in cross-functional teams in an agile environmentKnowledge of software-development processes, dependencies and digital products as well as methodologies and frameworks like Scrum and KanbanKnowledge of databases (e.g., SQL, NoSQL‚Ä¶), reporting tools (e.g. , Tableau) and cloud platforms (esp. Microsoft Azure)Ambition to master and not being intimidated by unstructured data and large datasetsWillingness to expand my comfort zone by sometimes leaving itVery good command of English language

Apply to our offer‚Ä¶üíü If you are passionate about technologiesüíü If you define yourself as a team workerüíü If you want to work with a multidisciplinary and international teamüíü If you want to be part of a company which is permanently expanding and growingüíü If you want to work in an international environment
Our offering:‚ú® Permanent contract‚ú® Competitive salary‚ú® 22 days of vacation‚ú® 5 additional holidays for Christmas‚ú® 4 additional holidays for Easter‚ú® Flexible working time‚ú® Continuous working days in summer
Committed to equality, at Quantion we believe in diversity and inclusion. We defend equal opportunities without discriminating based on gender, age, religion or sexual orientation or any other aspect that could be considered exclusive.

title: Data Analyst
description:
About The Job
Each time we eat and drink, we vote for the world we want to live in.
Danone‚Äôs mission is bringing health through food to as many people as possible and we want to invite people to join the movement for a healthier world. We recognize the power people have to impact the world through their daily choices. Healthy food needs a healthy planet, and this is what our new signature One Planet One Health embodies.
Danette, Evian, Activia, Volvic, Bl√©dina, sound familiar to you? Do you know that behind these brands there is always Information Technology pushing them forward?
At Danone, we use advanced and innovative IT solutions which are implemented in all Danone units around the world to contribute to our mission bringing health through food to as many people as possible. Don‚Äôt wait, click and discover the Danone IS/IT universe and join the movement your IT skills could be a real asset for the alimentation revolution!
https//youtu.be/MqjF1HxsTyw
About You
Profile & Experience
 Minimum of 5-6 years‚Äô experience in the Data & Analytics Domain.  Minimum of 1 -2 years‚Äô experience as Functional or Business Analyst in a product team.  Proven Track record of Implementing efficient and flexible dashboards / reports / data visualization capabilities.  Ability to demonstrate a mix of technical skills and business processes knowledge and proven experience in rolling out a data product in multiple markets. Essential to have experience in experience in data catalogue documentation and manage the product use throughout all the stages of the product lifecycle.  Experience working with Data Architects, Ingestion, Data scientists, Developers and visualization teams in an agile framework.  Strong ability to connect and communicate to distinct stakeholders in a complex organization, managing stakeholders from Global, Local, Business and IT colleagues.  Experience implementing modern data strategies and solutions using cloud technologies (Azure, AWS, Google), Informatica Cloud, Power BI or similar tools. 
Competencies
 A minimum of a Bachelor's /Masters Degree is required; a field in Computer Science, Math, or statistical background.  Excellent level in SQL-like languages (SQL, Python, NOSQL, ‚Ä¶), data warehousing(Snowflake/ redshift/ others) Feeling comfortable with the implementation of dashboards with the main reporting tools in the industry (PowerBI / SpotfIre / Kibana etc., or equivalent) Good knowledge and curiosity about best-in-class Data technologies Experienced in Functional Analysis/ Business Analysis / Data Analysis Proficiency in English Comfortable with written and verbal communication - strong analytic mind Capability to express complex data concepts into lay language for stakeholder management
About Us
As a Data Analyst, you will be our eyes in the ocean of data. We expect you to run experiments and studies to find quantitative answers from simple to more complex business or internal questions, having an easy access, and critical view on our data. This role will help the team to have a good control on the content of the data, the consistency, the quality, and should be able to provide deeper insights into the data.
We are looking for a Data Analyst to take the responsibility of designing the specification required for the developments we will plan to find the right data sources, how to transform them, how to analyze & provide insights, while ensuring the functional tests/validations, and creating the definition of done and make sure it is reached, together with the Product Owners.
We are looking for a candidate who has a strong knowledge on both data analyze/querying Data using SQL/ Python, visualizing through PowerBI and a good experience in turning the business needs into analytical insights and provide recommendations to the business with problem solving techniques.
In this position you will be reponsible for
Data Analysis Expertise
Data Analysis querying and exploit the data sets, tables, read and define the right data marts, navigate into the different environment (DWH, Datalakes, etc.) and extract relevant data for businessData Based Decision & Advices know how to leverage the quantitative insight from the data while keeping a critical eye to the content/reliability/information provided. Answering questions, providing precise insights or order of magnitudes easily. Data visualization represent the data insights in synthetic / tailor made dashboards and reports (Power BI, and/or other standard Business Intelligence tools)
Product Support to Data Governance
Knowledge Management keeping an up-to-date documentation / data & metadata description and linking it with the Data Excellence/Master Data Management program and MDM tools. Monitoring Being proactive in the definition of the data quality KPIs to ensure a well monitored data quality level. 
Implementation Follow-Up and Operationel Excellence
Backlog Gather and refine the backlog of user‚Äôs stories/requirements and ensure the right execution of the priorities set by the Product Owners & Senior Product Owners. Turn business needs into deliverablesThe description, documentation, and functional tests of new features to be done. Define the rules to validate the expected implementation of the features / User‚Äôs Stories (Definition Of Done)Validate the deliveries with the right quality/non-regression level. MVPs Maximizes efficiency in a constantly evolving environment using Minimal Viable Product delivery, and rapid prototyping. Keep a flexible/agile state of mind, while managing the backlog transparently and efficiently and communicating regularly on the progresses. 
Experience in developing innovative data solutions, agile ways of working, intellectual curiosity, and collaborating with small agile delivery teams are critical to enable you to be successful. Furthermore, it is important that you possess strong problem-solving skills and ability to logically analyse complex requirements or processes.
You will be a passionate with the ability to gain business partner agreement, communicate confidently at both the technical and data team level, and collaborate with a wide variety of technical and non-technical teams

title: Data Scientist - BCG X
description: BCG Boston Consulting Group partners with leaders in business and society to tackle their most important challenges and capture their greatest opportunities. BCG was the pioneer in business strategy when it was founded in 1963. Today, we help clients with total transformation-inspiring complex change, enabling organizations to grow, building competitive advantage, and driving bottom-line impact.  BCG X BCG X is the tech build & design unit of BCG. Turbocharging BCG‚Äôs deep industry and functional expertise, BCG X brings together advanced tech knowledge and ambitious entrepreneurship to help organizations enable innovation at scale. With nearly 3,000 technologists, scientists, programmers, engineers, and human-centered designers located across 80+ cities, BCG X builds and designs platforms and software to address the world‚Äôs most important challenges and opportunities. Teaming across our practices, and in close collaboration with our clients, our end-to-end global team unlocks new possibilities. Together we‚Äôre creating the bold and disruptive products, services, and businesses of tomorrow. WHAT YOU‚ÄôLL DO As a Data Scientist, you‚Äôll be part of our rapidly growing team. You‚Äôll have the chance to apply data science methods and analytics to real-world business situations across a variety of industries to drive significant business impact. You‚Äôll have the chance to partner with clients in a variety of BCG regions and industries, and on key topics like climate change, enabling them to design, build, and deploy new and innovative solutions. Additional responsibilities will include developing and delivering thought leadership in scientific communities and papers as well as leading conferences on behalf of BCG GAMMA. Successful candidates are intellectually curious builders who are biased toward action, scrappy, and communicative.  WHO YOU ARE We are looking for talented individuals with a passion for data science, statistics, operations research and transforming organizations into AI led innovative companies Comfortable in a client-facing role with the ambition to lead teams Likes to distill complex results or processes into simple, clear visualizations Explain sophisticated data science concepts in an understandable manner Love building things and are comfortable working with modern development tools and writing code collaboratively (bonus points if you have a software development or DevOps experience) Significant experience applying advanced analytics to a variety of business situations and a proven ability to synthesize complex data Deep understanding of modern machine learning techniques and their mathematical underpinnings, and can translate this into business implications for our clients Have strong project management skills  WHAT YOU‚ÄôLL BRING (EXPERIENCE & QUALIFICATION) Master‚Äôs Degree in computer science, applied mathematics, statistics, machine learning, or other data centric disciplines with relevant internships or up to 2-4 years of relevant industry work experience providing advanced analytics solutions Strong record of extracurricular activity, professional accomplishment, and leadership Additional experience in core analytic methods such as predictive modeling, customer segmentation/clustering, network analysis, supply chain optimization, simulation, etc. Fluency in at least one coding language (Python)  WORK ENVIRONMENT Fast-paced, intellectually intense, service-oriented environment Fluency in English is required as well as fluency in the local language for most locations Ability to travel based on client and business needs. Expect 30-50% Position is located in either Paris, London, Amsterdam, Germany, Vienna, Nordics, Warsaw, Moscow, Milan, Zurich, Casablanca, Johannesburg or Madrid  The Boston Consulting Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity / expression, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected under federal, state or local law, where applicable, and those with criminal histories will be considered in

description:

¬øC√≥mo lo har√°s?

En Holaluz las reuniones y decisiones se toman de forma colaborativa, fluye el feedback ü§ü entre los diferentes equipos y se fomenta el apoyo entre personas.

#AlwaysPeopleFirst es tambi√©n un valor muy importante en Holaluz, y para nosotros es clave tener un buen equipo de trabajo, por eso te explicamos que somos un equipo de unas 800 personas con un ambiente inmejorable, y con las que tendr√°s la oportunidad de trabajar en tu d√≠a a d√≠a üòÅ.

Adem√°s, trabajar√°s de la mano con Adri√† y V√≠ctor de tu equipo de Data y junto con tus stakeholders. ¬øSab√≠as que nuestro Chapter de Analytics est√° compuesto por casi el 50% de talento femenino? ¬°Te presentamos a dos compa√±eras!

üë©üèæ‚Äçüé§ Marta 

Matem√°tica, valenciana y gran aficionada al baloncesto. Es muy fan de hacer listas para todo y darle un toque de humor a cada reuni√≥n. Marta combina sus m√∫ltiples hobbies con su pasi√≥n por una visualizaci√≥n bien estructurada. Y a pesar de tener muchas reuniones, si le ofreces tomar un caf√© mientras coment√°is alg√∫n tema, aceptar√° sin dudarlo.

ü¶πüèª‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è √àlia

Es la m√°s joven del equipo pero desborda sabidur√≠a. √àlia es una optimista incorregible con un don para encontrar el lado bueno de las cosas. En 5min te contagiar√° su buen rollo. A la catalana del equipo le encanta la escalada y siempre busca nuevos retos con unas ganas inagotables por aprender de otras √°reas. El saber no ocupa lugar.

¬øD√≥nde lo har√°s?Qu√© mejor lugar para hacerlo que en nuestras oficinas de Barcelona a s√≥lo 200 metros del mar üåä. Esta excepcional ubicaci√≥n al lado de la playa es perfecta para hacer un break con chapuz√≥n y poder poner en pr√°ctica otro de nuestros valores #HaveFun.

Requirements

Hemos pensado muy muy bien lo que buscamos y lo que de verdad importa:

Licenciatura en Ciencias Empresariales/Econ√≥micas, Matem√°ticas o Ingenier√≠a.M√°s de 5 a√±os de experiencia en el campo de Data Analytics, y solvencia en el uso de SQL y de PythonHabilidades anal√≠ticas de alto nivel y capacidad de traducir informaci√≥n en insights accionables y en informes concisos.Storytelling y capacidad de comunicar las conclusiones de tus an√°lisis.Capacidad para trabajar eficazmente en equipo.Gran atenci√≥n a los detalles.No hace falta que seas Shakespeare, pero s√≠ que puedas comunicarte en Ingl√©s.

Todo suma, as√≠ que si tienes alguna de estas cosas SUMA Y SIGUE:

Requisitos deseables:

Orientaci√≥n al Cliente.Capacidad para mantener relaciones interpersonales.Alta capacidad de implicaci√≥n, dedicaci√≥n y motivaci√≥n.Elevada orientaci√≥n a la consecuci√≥n de objetivos y al cumplimiento de resultados.Excelente capacidad de an√°lisis.

Benefits

title: Data Analyst - Tableau / PHARMA
description:
Hays is collaborating with the leading company in the pharmaceutical sector, TOP 10 pharma with more than 146 affiliates around the world and 47 employees, of which 1,600 are located in Spain.They create innovative medicines for people and animals, adding value through innovation for all three business areas: human pharmaceuticals, animal health, and contract manufacturing of biopharmaceuticals.
Now they are in the expansion phase and are developing the animal area. Our client is forming a technological hub that will serve the entire group internationally. This hub is located in San Cugat del Vall√©s.
We are looking for a Data Analyst - Tableau to join their Data team
What will your duties be?
Connect with different markets around the globe and understand their dataOrganize data in a way it can be used and analyzed in an efficient way across markets and stakeholdersAnalyze / interpret this data to extract business value andClear Communication of your findings to the stakeholdersDeliver according to high standards with regards to consistency, usability and qualityExtraction, Organization, Analysis and Reporting - Data/Business
Which are the ideal requirements?
5 years progressive work experience in data management and/or data modelling3+ years' experience in leading data projectsDemonstrated expertise in Business (Process) Analysis and defining KPIs to drive business performanceHighly skilled in SQL -Tableau- data visualization techniques or similar tools. Ability to negotiate and influence across a matrix & cross-functional organizationGood judgment in evaluating benefits and risks and providing sound recommendations.English fluentGood communication and mediation skills and Strong results orientation. Ability to plan and organize work. Observation, interviewing and listening skills.
What we offer?
Participate in international projects.Young and dynamic environment.Flexible Schedule. (from 8 to 17 hrs or from 9 to 18 hrs).Homeoffice.(2/3 days week).Buffet onsite.Location: Sant Cugat del Vall√®s (Barcelona)Contract by Hays in a long project (m.c. Indefinido).Salary depend on candidate¬¥s experience

 We are waiting for profiles like yours, passionate about technology and who want to face a new challenge. If this is your case, sign up for the offer so we can tell you more!

title: Data Engineer
description:
Thanks to our innovative BuyNow PayLater payment solution, Scalapay is transforming the way more than 3.5 million customers buy online and in-store, empowering 5,000+ merchants to give their customers magical shopping experiences.
Being only 3 years old didn‚Äôt stop us from becoming a unicorn ü¶Ñ We have raised over $700mln and we did this thanks to a team built around our 4 core values: #createmagic #staycurious #beimpactful #playasateam.
This is where your magic happens. If you love it, Scalapay it ‚ô•
THE MISSION
Data-driven decisions are the centre of our efforts to automate processes and support decisions across the business.
As Data Engineer, your role will focus on developing distributed software for large-scale heterogeneous data processing, the development of ETL and reverse ETL pipeline.
You will be responsible for:
 Data modelling Data lineage Data quality / Data observability SLA, performance and scalability
You‚Äôll be required to discuss requirements for data access and integrations with colleagues across the business, design solutions to the company‚Äôs problems and implement these using modern software processes in the cloud.
The role gives a large amount of autonomy and the chance to work with a top-notch team of experienced data experts.
Who we are looking for: 
 Strong Python and SQL experience Experience building and deploying ETL pipelines Experience with API integration Ability to scope projects and decompose work into tasks Familiarity with Linux-like development stacks, including Git, Kubernetes, etc Familiarity with AWS infrastructure (such as S3, Athena, Glue, etc) Knowledge of Data Modeling / Data Observability is a plus Ability to engage with colleagues on business processes A Bachelor's degree in computer science or a related field
Why you should join Scalapay:
 Attractive packages based on skills and experience International environment with significant challenges to be met every day Lots of opportunities to work with a team of industry tech leaders who are focused on delivering products that offer exceptional user experiences Personalised support to accelerate your professional growth and take ownership of the products you deliver: we want to help you grow! Latest technologies and being encouraged to bring your flair to the role
Recruitment Process:
 A quick chat with one of our Talent Acquisition team members The first interview with the Hiring Manager to deep dive into your experiences and better understand your motivation A case study to test your hard skills A Meet The Team session where you‚Äôll get to meet different people at Scalapay and see if you‚Äôll fit into our culture
_________________________________________________________________________
Want to learn more? Don't hesitate to explore our Careers website and Careers website, and our LinkedIn, WTTJ, Meritocracy and Glassdoor pages.
Pro tip: send your CV in English üòâ
Super Pro tip: we know that application processes can be scary and frustrating but‚Ä¶ we look for talent, not people that tick all our boxes.
We believe in the power of diversity: Scalapay is an Equal Opportunity Employer for any minority, disability, gender identity or sexual orientation.

title: Operations Data Analyst
description:
Who We Are

Bitpanda simplifies wealth creation. Founded in 2014 in Vienna, Austria by Eric Demuth, Paul Klanschek and Christian Trummer, Bitpanda exists to help people trust themselves enough to build financial freedom for their future. Our user-friendly, trade-everything platform empowers both first-time investors and seasoned experts to invest in the cryptocurrencies, crypto indices, stocks, precious metals and commodities they want ‚Äî all possible with any sized budget , 24/7. With more than 700 team members and more than 4 million customers, our company is one of Europe's most successful fintechs.

Headquartered in Austria but operating across all of Europe, our products are built by fast-moving, talented, ‚Äúroll-up-your-sleeves-and-make-it-happen‚Äù kind of people who represent more than 50 nationalities. If you‚Äôre someone who thinks big, moves fast and wants to make an impact right from day one, then get ready to join our industry-changing team. Let‚Äôs go!

Your Mission

As an Operations Data Analyst, you will drive daily operations through data processing, insightful findings, and strategic decision-making. In this role, you will be expected to deeply understand our business requirements and deliver comprehensive, standardised data solutions for various stakeholders across the company.

What You‚Äôll Do
 Analyse large amounts of data, providing data extractions and dashboards tailored to diverse stakeholder needs.  Develop an in-depth understanding of our data ecosystem, continually suggesting improvements to infrastructure and data integrity to meet the operational demands.  Construct and manage our operational data infrastructure, and maintain our Git repository.  Applying Business Process Management Systems (BPMS) and Artificial Intelligence/Machine Learning (AI/ML) techniques to automate operational processes.  Drive data-focused projects, like devising KPI dashboards, alerts for significant business events, and performance monitoring and cultivate data expertise within the team by conducting targeted workshops and trainings. 

Who You Are
 A minimum of 3 years of relevant experience in a fintech or e-commerece company.  Taking a proactive approach for gathering requirements from a variety of stakeholders to create flexible solutions for operations needs.  Practical experience with Metabase, Snowflake, Tableau, GitLab, DataGrip, PyCharm, and JSON. Familiarity with DataDog and Hype is an added bonus.  Understanding of cryptocurrency and blockchain. 

What‚Äôs In It For You
Competitive total compensation package including participation in our stock option planMarket-leading Flex-Ben approach and package (see our careers page)Exclusive premiums when trading on BitpandaOccasional company-wide and team events - both in-person and virtually!Bitpanda swag to keep you living the brandA diverse team of fast-moving, talented, ‚Äúroll-up-your-sleeves-and-make-it-happen‚Äù kind of people who are united (across cultures and time zones) by our unique way of working

And, above all, the opportunity to learn and grow as part of Bitpanda‚Äôs incredible journey towards being Europe‚Äôs future #1 investment platform.

Bitpanda is committed to fostering a fair and equal environment based on trust and mutual respect. We believe that a diverse and inclusive workplace is paramount to our success and we are committed to building a team that represents a wide variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills.

title: Data Business Analyst
description:
Data Business Analyst ‚Äì Focus Data Cataloguing, Master Data Management (MDM) and Reference Data Management (RDM)
Do you have a passion for Data? Are you an experienced Business Analyst with a data focus? Would you like to be part of driving a change in how AstraZeneca Operations works with data management?
About AstraZeneca
AstraZeneca is a global, innovation-driven Biopharmaceutical business that focuses on the discovery, development and commercialization of prescription medicines for some of the world‚Äôs most serious disease. We‚Äôre more than one of the world‚Äôs leading pharmaceutical companies.
At AstraZeneca, we put our patients first and we‚Äôre dedicated to being a Great Place to Work, where you are empowered to push the boundaries of science and unleash your entrepreneurial spirit. There‚Äôs no better place to make a difference in medicine, patients and society. An inclusive culture that champions diversity and collaboration, always committed to lifelong learning, growth and development.
About Our Team
We lead AstraZeneca‚Äôs transformation in Operations IT, fusing our digital and data capabilities in strong partnership with our business to make it happen. Accelerating our business as we empower the core functions to work better and faster. By partnering across the business, we‚Äôre leveraging our leading technologies and exploring data to make data driven decisions and enabling the business to reach the right outcomes, quicker.
We challenge, innovate and break away from the norm to find bold new ways of simplifying and automating our business processes. Always passionate about leading the way for sustainable digital healthcare. This cannot be done in isolation. Empowerment and working together as one, giving our diverse team of specialists the freedom to explore and express their ideas and views. A place to realize the true impact and difference data and digital can make.
What You‚Äôll Do
As a Data Business Analyst ‚Äì Focus Data Cataloguing, Data Quality technology, Master Data Management (MDM) and Reference Data Management (RDM) you will be part of our Global Data Team in Operations IT and be our thought leader for these technologies in close collaboration with our enterprise platform teams and solution architects as well as our business owners ‚Äì Operations Data Office.
In the role you will:
Collaborate with our Sr Data BA‚Äôs and Solutions Architects to define the future technology strategy and roadmap for MDM, RDM, Data Quality and data Cataloging.Collaborate and partner with our Data Office when agreeing the future approach in Data Quality, MDM, RDM and Data CataloguingYou will help drive the implementation and roll out of the technologies within Operations in collaboration with PMs, BA‚Äôs and business users.Where technology is in use, you will lead the improvement work in collaboration with the business users towards the enterprise platform teams.Define ways of working and RACIs, aligning with the enterprise definitions, and specify what this means for Operations. Once these are in place you will be active in driving continuous improvements and simplificationsReaching the right results through business analysis on a variety of different system landscapes, interpreting what will be the right future solutions, collaborating and influencing with both different user groups as well as global IT to solution and implement in line with our standards.In this role, you will be part of setting standards for processes and capturing demand/requirements for the Global IT functions that support Data across Operations.Ensuring that the methodology, quality and compliance standards contribute to internal processes and standards for business analysis and design.
Essential Skills
To be successful in this role you will demonstrate good communication and presentation skills as well as a high customer focus.As a person, you dare to challenge, influence and negotiate.Evidence experience in leading and facilitating changeEvidence experience of Data Cataloguing, Data Quality technology, MDM and RDMBe confident in business analysis and process design in a complex business situation.A solid foundation of general technical knowledgeStrong Collaboration skillsFluent in English both verbal and writtenGood written documentation skills and Experience of working in a regulated environment.Exposure to working with Information Flows and Data ArchitectureStrong engagement, communication and partner leadership skillsExperience in virtual collaboration to lead, shape and develop innovative solutions.A passion for data processes and their importance in driving business performance
Desirable Skills
Degree in a relevant subject area or formal certification in business analysis practice.Design thinking and facilitation skills.Lean training.Experience of working in a global organization with a complex/geographical context.SAP Experience (SAP MDM; SAP MDG; SAP ECC)Collibra or other Data Catalogue technologyMDM technology such as ReltioDQ Tooling
WHY JOIN US?
We‚Äôre a network of entrepreneurial self-starters who contribute to something far bigger. There‚Äôs a diversity of expertise in our Technology group that‚Äôs unique to AstraZeneca ‚Äì it allows us to dive deep into exploring new leading-edge technology. We enable AstraZeneca to perform at its peak by delivering world-class technology and data solutions. Our work unlocks the potential of science. We optimise and evolutionise AstraZeneca by maximising efficiencies and finding new ways to drive productivity. From automation to data simplification. We‚Äôre not afraid to take ownership and run with it. Empowered with unrivalled freedom. A place to be open and transparent ‚Äì we speak up, think creatively and share ideas. Our diverse contributions help us to make better decisions. But we have a constant drive to innovate, and an appreciation for high standards. It takes challenging the status quo to add value in our ever-evolving environment. We love it here because put simply, we make a meaningful impact.
Technology at AstraZeneca is a home for purposeful disruptors!
SO, WHAT‚ÄôS NEXT? 
Are you already imagining yourself joining our team? Good, because we‚Äôd love to hear from you!

title: Data Analyst Intern
description:
Description

Wallbox is a global company, dedicated to changing the way the world uses energy. We do this by creating smart charging systems that combine innovative technology with outstanding design and manage the communication between vehicle, grid, building, and charger.

Founded in 2015, with headquarters in Barcelona and selling already in over 80+ countries, our mission is to facilitate the adoption of electric vehicles today to make more sustainable use of energy tomorrow. Our talent has no borders - we welcome over 1K Wallboxers from over 45 nationalities in Europe, Asia, and the Americas!

We‚Äôre the first Spanish unicorn listed on the NYSE and have been recently named among LinkedIn‚Äôs top 3 Spanish startups.

At Wallbox you come first, so we offer a tailored career plan that aligns with your professional goals.

Our journey is not plain sailing - it requires proactive, flexible, and top-performing individuals who are committed to the world of sustainable mobility. But one thing is for sure - it's going to be a fun ride!

The question is: are you ready to change the world with us?

You will:
Engage with internal stakeholders to gain an understanding of the problems that need to be solved and gather requirements for analytical tasks Model and evaluate user and device behaviour in order to identify potential value of planned projectsEnable data-driven product and business development through analysis of device, in-app, and external dataExtract, load, and reconcile large data sets from multiple system platforms and sources.

Requirements
Academic background in Science, Mathematics, Engineering, Economics or similar.Analytical and quantitative skills with good exposure to SQLYou are motivated to get meaningful information out of large sets of data and can communicate your findings in a clear way.Highly energetic, self-motivated, and results-oriented person.Good communication skills both verbal and written.Fluent in business English An interest in advanced analytics, machine learning, and emerging technologies is appreciated.

Benefits
Internship agreement of six months with the opportunity extend based on performance.Flexible working hoursHybrid workFriday¬¥s afternoons off!Unlimited coffee to fuel your mornings.Monthly ‚ÄúAll Hands‚Äù & other team events.International environment: Over 45 different nationalities.No suits! Unless it‚Äôs Carnival or Halloween.

Please submit your CV in English
At Wallbox, we‚Äôre committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, colour, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender, gender identity or expression, or veteran status. We strive to be a more equal opportunity workplace.

title: Data Analyst Intern
description:
R00201258
As a part of the Digital Capabilities team in the Procurement Analytics and Digital Solutions group you will be responsible for continuous improvements in digital capabilities and advanced analytics. You will lead the development of new digital products providing critical insights that help solve business challenges. The successful candidate will lead efforts to improve the chemical data understanding across the organization through improved process, governance, and data management.
Candidates must display a passion for systems, data, operational reporting & advanced analytics. The strong performer can expect further career advancement opportunities with Ecolab and will have the chance to move into other roles within Procurement or the organization, with increasing leadership opportunities. This is an exciting opportunity to advance your career with a stable growing company!
Main ResponsibilitiesServe as a liaison among stakeholders to analyze, document, and validate requirements for reporting and changes to business processes Develop and maintain data productsDevelop, test, and operationalize new standardized reportingDevelop and maintain business intelligence dashboards Lead automation of processes and analysesTrain other teams in systems, tools, and processes owned by ADSProactively make recommendations and identify opportunities to solve business problems through new business intelligence reportingInterface with IT to specify and implement improvements to our data pipelines
Basic Qualifications
Interest in an analytical or business intelligence roleExperience with data visualization and presenting insights to key stakeholdersExceptional analytical and problem-solving abilitiesProficient in MS Office suiteIntermediate SQL skills, or willingness to learnIntermediate DAX skills, or willingness to learn
Preferred Qualifications
Experience designing and building standard reports and dashboardsHistory of managing and delivering projects, tasks, and initiativesAbility to create, implement, document, and continuously improve processes in a changing environmentTraining or experience in data science areas such as time series analysis, forecasting, classification, and regression analysisExperience with data analytics tools such as Python, R, SPSS, MATLAB, Stata, and SASExperience working with global cross-functional teams and demonstrated ability to work well with people from different disciplines with varying degrees of technical expertiseMicrosoft PowerBI experienceProject management experienceExperience in the petrochemical industry a plusEnrolled in or recently completed degree with emphasis in Chemistry, Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Information Technology, or Engineering preferred
Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion
At Ecolab, we believe the best teams are diverse and inclusive, and we are on a journey to create a workplace where every associate can grow and achieve their best. We are committed to fair and equal treatment of associates and applicants. We recruit, hire, promote, transfer and provide opportunities for advancement on the basis of individual qualifications and job performance. In all matters affecting employment, compensation, benefits, working conditions, and opportunities for advancement, we will not discriminate against any associate or applicant for employment because of race, religion, color, creed, national origin, citizenship status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and expressions, genetic information, marital status, age, disability, or status as a covered veteran.
In addition, we are committed to furthering the principles of Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) through Affirmative Action (AA). Our goal is to fully utilize minority, female, disabled and covered veteran individuals at all levels of the workforce. Ecolab is a place where you can grow your career, own your future and impact what matters.

title: Data Analyst
description:
